009package com.weather.sdk.cache;
010
011import com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData;
012import java.time.Duration;
013import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
014import java.util.Locale;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.Optional;
017
018/**
019 * Default implementation of the WeatherCache interface with LRU eviction and TTL support.
020 *
021 * <p>This class provides a thread-safe cache for weather data with the following features:
022 *
023 * <ul>
024 *   <li><strong>LRU Eviction</strong>: When cache reaches maximum size, automatically evicts the
025 *       least recently used entry
026 *   <li><strong>TTL Support</strong>: Each cache entry has a configurable time-to-live and
027 *       automatically expires after the TTL duration
028 *   <li><strong>Thread Safety</strong>: All operations are thread-safe and can be called
029 *       concurrently by multiple threads
030 *   <li><strong>Cache Key Normalization</strong>: City names are normalized to lowercase, trimmed
031 *       format for consistent lookup
032 * </ul>
033 *
034 * <p><strong>Implementation Details:</strong> This implementation uses a LinkedHashMap with
035 * access-order enabled for LRU eviction. The {@code removeEldestEntry()} method automatically
036 * removes the least recently used entry when the cache exceeds maximum size. All public methods are
037 * synchronized to ensure thread safety.
038 *
039 * <h2>Usage Example</h2>
040 *
041 * <pre>
042 * // Create cache with max 100 cities and 10-minute TTL
043 * WeatherCache cache = new DefaultWeatherCache(Duration.ofMinutes(10), 100);
044 *
045 * // Store weather data
046 * WeatherData weatherData = createWeatherDataFor("London");
047 * cache.put("London", weatherData);
048 *
049 * // Retrieve weather data
050 * Optional{@code <WeatherData>} cached = cache.get("London");
051 * if (cached.isPresent()) {
052 *   System.out.println("Cached weather: " + cached.get());
053 * }
054 *
055 * // Check cache size
056 * int currentSize = cache.size();
057 * </pre>
058 *
059 * @since 1.0.0
060 * @see WeatherCache
061 * @see WeatherData
062 */
063@SuppressWarnings("CT_CONSTRUCTOR_THROW")
064public class DefaultWeatherCache implements WeatherCache {
065
066  /** Maximum number of cities to cache. */
067  private final int maxSize;
068
069  /** Time-to-live for cached entries. */
070  private final Duration ttl;
071
072  /** Internal storage for cached entries with LRU ordering. */
073  private final Map<String, CacheEntry> cache;
074
075  /**
076   * Constructs a new DefaultWeatherCache with the specified parameters.
077   *
078   * <p>This constructor creates a LinkedHashMap with access-order enabled for LRU eviction. When
079   * the cache reaches maximum size, the least recently accessed entry is automatically removed.
080   *
081   * @param ttl the time-to-live for cached entries (must not be null or non-positive)
082   * @param maxSize the maximum number of cities to cache (must be positive)
083   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if ttl is null, negative, or zero, or if maxSize is not
084   *     positive
085   */
086  @SuppressWarnings("CT_CONSTRUCTOR_THROW")
087  public DefaultWeatherCache(final Duration ttl, final int maxSize) {
088    // Initialize fields first to avoid partial initialization
089    this.ttl = ttl;
090    this.maxSize = maxSize;
091
092    // Validate parameters after field initialization
093    if (ttl == null || ttl.isNegative() || ttl.isZero()) {
094      throw new IllegalArgumentException("TTL must be positive and not null");
095    }
096    if (maxSize <= 0) {
097      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Max size must be positive");
098    }
099
100    // Create LinkedHashMap with access-order for LRU eviction
101    // Initial capacity: maxSize + 1, load factor: 0.75f, accessOrder: true
102    this.cache =
103        new LinkedHashMap<>(maxSize + 1, 0.75f, true) {
104          @Override
105          protected boolean removeEldestEntry(final Map.Entry<String, CacheEntry> eldest) {
106            // Automatically remove eldest entry when size exceeds maxSize
107            return DefaultWeatherCache.this.size() > DefaultWeatherCache.this.maxSize;
108          }
109        };
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Normalizes a city name for consistent cache key lookup.
114   *
115   * <p>Normalizes by converting to lowercase and trimming whitespace.
116   *
117   * @param cityName the city name to normalize (must not be null)
118   * @return the normalized city name
119   */
120  private String normalizeCityName(final String cityName) {
121    if (cityName == null) {
122      throw new IllegalArgumentException("City name must not be null");
123    }
124    return cityName.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Retrieves weather data for the specified city from the cache.
129   *
130   * <p>This method performs TTL expiration checks and automatically removes expired entries. The
131   * access order is updated for LRU eviction when a valid entry is accessed.
132   *
133   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
134   * @return an {@link Optional} containing the cached weather data if found and valid, or {@link
135   *     Optional#empty()} if not found or expired
136   */
137  @Override
138  public synchronized Optional<WeatherData> get(final String cityName) {
139    final String normalizedKey = normalizeCityName(cityName);
140    final CacheEntry entry = cache.get(normalizedKey);
141
142    Optional<WeatherData> result = Optional.empty();
143
144    if (entry != null) {
145      // Check if entry has expired based on TTL
146      final long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
147      final long entryAge = currentTime - entry.getTimestamp();
148      final long ttlMillis = ttl.toMillis();
149
150      if (entryAge > ttlMillis) {
151        // Entry has expired, remove it
152        cache.remove(normalizedKey);
153      } else {
154        // Entry is valid, return the data (access order updated automatically by
155        // LinkedHashMap)
156        result = Optional.of(entry.getData());
157      }
158    }
159
160    return result;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Stores weather data for the specified city in the cache.
165   *
166   * <p>This method records the current timestamp for TTL calculation. The LinkedHashMap
167   * automatically handles LRU eviction when the cache exceeds maxSize.
168   *
169   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
170   * @param weatherData the weather data to cache (must not be null)
171   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if weatherData is null
172   */
173  @Override
174  public synchronized void put(final String cityName, final WeatherData weatherData) {
175    if (weatherData == null) {
176      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Weather data must not be null");
177    }
178
179    final String normalizedKey = normalizeCityName(cityName);
180    final CacheEntry entry = new CacheEntry(weatherData);
181
182    // Store entry with current timestamp
183    // LRU eviction handled automatically by LinkedHashMap's removeEldestEntry()
184    cache.put(normalizedKey, entry);
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Evicts (removes) the weather data entry for the specified city from the cache.
189   *
190   * <p>This method removes the entry if it exists. If the entry doesn't exist, this operation has
191   * no effect.
192   *
193   * @param cityName the city name (will be normalized to lowercase, trimmed)
194   */
195  @Override
196  public synchronized void evict(final String cityName) {
197    final String normalizedKey = normalizeCityName(cityName);
198    cache.remove(normalizedKey);
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Clears all entries from the cache.
203   *
204   * <p>This method removes all cached weather data and resets the cache to its initial state. After
205   * this operation, {@link #size()} will return 0.
206   */
207  @Override
208  public synchronized void clear() {
209    cache.clear();
210  }
211
212  /**
213   * Returns the current number of entries in the cache.
214   *
215   * <p>This includes both valid (non-expired) and expired entries that haven't been cleaned up yet.
216   * Expired entries are automatically removed during {@code get()} operations.
217   *
218   * @return the current number of entries in the cache
219   */
220  @Override
221  public synchronized int size() {
222    return cache.size();
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Returns a set of all cached city names.
227   *
228   * <p>This method provides access to all city names currently in the cache, which is useful for
229   * operations like polling all cached cities.
230   *
231   * @return a set of all cached city names (normalized to lowercase)
232   */
233  @Override
234  public synchronized java.util.Set<String> getAllCachedCities() {
235    return java.util.Collections.unmodifiableSet(new java.util.HashSet<>(cache.keySet()));
236  }
237
238  /**
239   * Internal wrapper class for cache entries that includes timestamp information.
240   *
241   * <p>This class is used to store weather data along with metadata for TTL expiration.
242   *
243   * @since 1.0.0
244   */
245  private static class CacheEntry {
246    /** The cached weather data. */
247    private final WeatherData data;
248
249    /** The timestamp when this entry was cached. */
250    private final long timestamp;
251
252    /**
253     * Constructs a new CacheEntry with the specified data and current timestamp.
254     *
255     * @param data the weather data to cache (must not be null)
256     */
257    /* default */ CacheEntry(final WeatherData data) {
258      this.data = data;
259      this.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Returns the cached weather data.
264     *
265     * @return the weather data (never null)
266     */
267    /* default */ WeatherData getData() {
268      return data;
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Returns the timestamp when this entry was cached.
273     *
274     * @return the timestamp in milliseconds since epoch
275     */
276    /* default */ long getTimestamp() {
277      return timestamp;
278    }
279  }
280}
